net.parallaxed.bluejam
Class NoteCollection

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Note>
              net.parallaxed.bluejam.NoteCollection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Note>, java.util.Collection<Note>, java.util.List<Note>, java.util.RandomAccess, NoteSequence
Direct Known Subclasses:
NoteContext
public class NoteCollection
extends java.util.ArrayList<Note>
implements NoteSequence

Simply contains a list of notes in their order of play. Note that this class is recursively typed, even though it wraps a collection of , those elements added to it MUST also implement NoteSequence. This class acts as a buffer between the playback classes and the evolution classes (i.e. note trees etc).

Author:
Ciarán Rowe (csr2@kent.ac.uk)
See Also:
Serialized Form

getNotes

public java.util.Iterator<Note> getNotes()
This abstracted function returns an iterator capable of accessing each note in the NoteSequence in an ordered fashion. Since an the representation of a note tree may be in no particular order, implementation of this function forces an order to be imposed at some point. In short, this allows the NoteSequence to be read into a buffer for playback through one of the appropriate classes NoteSequences are normally collapsed into NoteCollections using this iterator, to fix the ordering before playback. __ADD SEE CLAUSES__

Specified by:
getNotes in interface NoteSequence
Returns:
An iterator over this NoteCollection

removeNotes

public void removeNotes(NoteSequence notes)
Removes a note from the NoteSequence. Removal of a note should (in a linear representation) shift all subsequent notes left. For removing a note without this behaviour, see restNote()

Specified by:
removeNotes in interface NoteSequence
Parameters:
notes - A reference to the note to be removed.
See Also:
NoteSequence

swapNotes

public boolean swapNotes(NoteSequence swapOut,
                         NoteSequence swapIn)
Swaps notes in a sequence. The supplied NoteSequence is located, and replaced by the given NoteSequence. Depending on the implementation, this function can be designed to act as mutation, 1-point crossover, or both.

Specified by:
swapNotes in interface NoteSequence
Parameters:
swapOut - First argument to swap
swapIn - Second argument to swap
See Also:
NoteSequence
